Token.Abstract: This requests that the specified transaction be refunded to the account holder
The amount of the refund being requested
The amount of the refund being requested
The amount of the refund being requested
The transaction ID that the refund will be applied against
The transaction ID that the refund will be applied against
The transaction ID that the refund will be applied against

Client-generated unique ID for each transaction, used as a way to prevent the processing of duplicate transactions. The orderId must be unique to the merchant's SecureNet ID; however, uniqueness is only evaluated for APPROVED transactions and only for the last 30 days. If a transaction is declined, the corresponding orderId may be used again.

Client-generated unique ID for each transaction, used as a way to prevent the processing of duplicate transactions. The orderId must be unique to the merchant's SecureNet ID; however, uniqueness is only evaluated for APPROVED transactions and only for the last 30 days. If a transaction is declined, the corresponding orderId may be used again.

Client-generated unique ID for each transaction, used as a way to prevent the processing of duplicate transactions. The orderId must be unique to the merchant's SecureNet ID; however, uniqueness is only evaluated for APPROVED transactions and only for the last 30 days. If a transaction is declined, the corresponding orderId may be used again.

Optional extended card data to be provided by the merchant. On card present transactions, the SDK will automatically add this object and populate card terminal information, including "Terminal ID". If a custom terminal ID is required, this object should be included or the terminal ID should be set via the request Auth token method

Optional extended card data to be provided by the merchant. On card present transactions, the SDK will automatically add this object and populate card terminal information, including "Terminal ID". If a custom terminal ID is required, this object should be included or the terminal ID should be set via the request Auth token method
